channel.title: How to add models to client
channel.description: ok so i have my .mdl files... what do i do now? i have: metaseq and dat maker 1. Do i need anything else? (programs) 2. What format has the model file have to be ( .gz or .dat) or does it even matter? Or is .gz only used for items and npcs that consist of more than 1 model?(some platebodies and npcs) 3. What do i need to replace the ##### with in "add model #####" .dat file or the id i found with rsmv or something else? 4. (not NEEDED but would help) :what do these do: [code] class8.anInt174 = //Inv & Ground class8.anInt181 = ??? class8.anInt190 = ??? class8.anInt198 = ??? class8.anInt204 = ??? class8.anInt169 = ??? class8.anInt194 = ??? class8.anInt165 = //Male Wield View class8.anInt200 = //Female Wield View class8.anInt188 = ??? class8.anInt164 = ??? class8.anInt175 = ??? class8.anInt197 = ??? [/code] the ones with "???" in the end[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 14, 2009, 04:51:55 am[/size][hr]any1?

item.title: How to add models to client
item.dc:creator: @illslayu illslayu
item.description:
@illslayu wrote:

ok so i have my .mdl files… what do i do now? i have: metaseq and dat maker

  1. Do i need anything else? (programs)
  2. What format has the model file have to be ( .gz or .dat) or does it even matter? Or is .gz only used for items and npcs that consist of more than 1 model?(some platebodies and npcs)
  3. What do i need to replace the ##### with in “add model #####” .dat file or the id i found with rsmv or something else?
  4. (not NEEDED but would help) :what do these do:
class8.anInt174 = //Inv & Ground
class8.anInt181 = ???
class8.anInt190 = ???
class8.anInt198 = ???
class8.anInt204 = ???
class8.anInt169 = ???
class8.anInt194 = ???
class8.anInt165 = //Male Wield View
class8.anInt200 = //Female Wield View
class8.anInt188 = ???
class8.anInt164 = ???
class8.anInt175 = ???
class8.anInt197 = ???

the ones with “???” in the end[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 14, 2009, 04:51:55 am[/size][hr]any1?

Read full topic
